Pre-Game Insights: Azerbaijan and Sweden will start their 2024 UEFA Nations League campaign at the Tofiq Bahramov Stadium.
Both teams are in Group 1 of League C and will compete with Slovakia and Estonia for promotion.
Azerbaijan secured a 3-2 victory over Kazakhstan in a friendly on June 11.
Azerbaijan's head coach Fernando Santos hopes to build on their recent win against Kazakhstan.
Azerbaijan finished second to last in their Euro qualifiers group with seven points from eight games.
Sweden lost 3-0 to Serbia in a friendly on June 8.
Sweden has lost three of their last four matches, with a 1-0 win over Albania being the exception.
Sweden aims to avenge their 3-0 loss to Azerbaijan in their last meeting during the Euro 2024 qualifiers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This will be the fifth meeting between Azerbaijan and Sweden, with Sweden winning three of the previous four encounters.
Azerbaijan's only win against Sweden came on November 16, with a 3-0 victory.
Sweden has failed to win five of their last six competitive away games, losing four and drawing one since June 2022.
Azerbaijan has won just two of their last eight competitive matches, losing five and drawing one since March 2023.
